titles: Theatrum chemicum BritannicumÂ· Containing severall poeticall pieces of our famous English philosophers, who have written the hermetique mysteries in their owne ancient language. / Faithfully collected into one volume, with annotations thereon, by Elias Ashmole, Esq. Qui est Mercuriophilus Anglicus. The first part.
author: Vaughan, Robert, engraver.
Cross, Thomas, fl. 1632-1682.
Ashmole, Elias, 1617-1692.
publisher: Printed by J. Grismond for Nath: Brooke, at the Angel in Cornhill,
notes: A collection of works by various writers, compiled by Ashmole.
Title page in red and black.
The frontispiece is engraved and signed "T. Cross sculp:"; most of the illustrations are signed: Ro: Vaughan. sculp:.
The last four leaves contain a table of contents and glossary.
Annotation on Thomason copy: The final "I" in the imprint is crossed out, and "1651" is written; "Febr. 4.".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
